info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN GREENE AND CENTRAL MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 846 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Moraine, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Beavercreek, Fairborn, Xenia, Trotwood, Moraine, Oakwood, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Wilberforce, Riverside, Shiloh, Fort Mckinley, John Bryan State Park, Oldtown, Drexel, Greene County Airport, Overlook-Page Mano and Trebein. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 49 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
